data.prayer: Jesus, like with the centurion who came to you for his sick servant, please call into your house those who have great faith but are not yet yours in the state of Kunduz
data.verse: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turning to the crowd that followed him, said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith.” And when those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the servant well.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Kunduz, Afghanistan
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Jesus, please find the broken hearted among the 1,136,700 souls in Kunduz and mend their wounds.
data.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

data.section_summary: On average, 84 people will die without Jesus in the next 100 hours in Kunduz, Afghanistan.
data.prayer: Lord, send your gospel to these.

Jesus, all authority was given to you, and you commanded all disciples in Kunduz, Afghanistan to make more disciples, and you promised to be with them. May your power and their obedience make more disciples today.
data.verse: All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me. Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.

data.prayer: Jesus, please give the apostles in Kunduz, Afghanistan a vision for the harvest, and a passion to see the gospel spread to every corner of the the state.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the Brahmin people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the Brahmin people.
Spirit, sanctify the 181 believers in Kunduz and keep them blameless until Jesus returns.
data.verse: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. He who calls you is faithful, who will also do it.

data.prayer: Father, please raise up every one you have called in Kunduz, Afghanistan to become worthy of their calling, and offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to you through Jesus.
data.verse: I urge you to live a life worthy of the calling you have received

data.prayer: Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Kunduz, Afghanistan that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
